Technology.name: Software Engineer
Technology.description: Designs, develops, and maintains software applications. The backbone of the digital world.
Technology.future_prospects: Evergreen field with constant demand. Specializations in AI, Cybersecurity, and Cloud are booming.
roadmap: Bachelor's in Computer Science
Build a project portfolio
Internships
Specialize in an area like backend, frontend, or mobile.

must_read_book.name: Clean Code by Robert C. Martin

Technology.name: Data Scientist
Technology.description: Uses data to answer complex questions and build predictive models. A mix of statistician, programmer, and business strategist.
Technology.future_prospects: Critical role in every data-driven company. High demand for specialists in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Computer Vision.
roadmap: Bachelor's in a quantitative field
Master's (MS) or Ph.D. in Data Science/Statistics is common
Develop a portfolio of data analysis projects
Start as a Data Analyst and grow.

must_read_book.name: Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras & TensorFlow

Business & Finance.name: Investment Banker
Business & Finance.description: Helps companies and governments raise capital by issuing stocks and bonds, and provides advice on mergers and acquisitions (M&A).
Business & Finance.future_prospects: Extremely high-paying field. Path to roles in private equity, hedge funds, or senior executive positions in corporations (CFO).
opportunities: Bulge Bracket Investment Banks (Goldman Sachs, J.P. Morgan)
roadmap: Degree from a top university in Finance/Economics
An MBA from a top business school is almost essential
Grueling interview process
Start as an Analyst and work long hours.

must_read_book.name: Barbarians at the Gate by Bryan Burrough

Business & Finance.name: Management Consultant
Business & Finance.description: Management Consultants help organizations solve problems and improve performance. They analyze businesses and create solutions to help them achieve their goals.
Business & Finance.future_prospects: A launchpad for high-level corporate careers. Many consultants become senior executives, join private equity firms, or start their own companies.
opportunities: Big Four accounting firms (Deloitte, PwC, EY, KPMG)
roadmap: Excel at a top undergraduate university (e.g., BBA in Business/Economics)
Obtain an MBA from a top-tier business school
Pass rigorous case interviews
Start as an Analyst or Associate.

must_read_book.name: Case in Point by Marc Cosentino

Healthcare.name: Medical Doctor (Physician)
Healthcare.description: Diagnoses and treats illnesses and injuries, provides health advice, and maintains patient health. Requires extensive education and training.
Healthcare.future_prospects: Core profession with perpetual demand. Specializations and super-specializations (e.g., neurosurgery, cardiology) offer high growth.
roadmap: High school with science focus
Bachelor's degree (MBBS in India, Pre-Med in US)
Postgraduate specialization (MD/MS)
Residency and fellowship training.

Arts & Design.name: Architect
Arts & Design.description: Architects plan and design buildings and other structures. They combine art and science to create functional, safe, and aesthetically pleasing spaces.
Arts & Design.future_prospects: Ability to start one's own firm. Growing demand for sustainable and 'green' architecture. Roles in urban planning and real estate development.
roadmap: Complete a Bachelor of Architecture (B.Arch) degree (5 years)
Gain practical experience through internships
Pass a professional licensure exam (e.g., from the Council of Architecture in India)
Work under a licensed architect before starting a firm.

must_read_book.name: The Architecture of Happiness by Alain de Botton

Science & Research.name: University Professor
Science & Research.description: An academic who teaches and conducts original research at a university. They are experts in their field, publish scholarly articles, and mentor students.
Science & Research.future_prospects: Path to achieving tenure, becoming a department head, and making a lasting impact on a field of study. Highly autonomous work.
roadmap: Complete a Bachelor's and Master's degree in your chosen field.
Earn a Ph.D., which involves years of intensive research and writing a dissertation.
Publish research papers in academic journals and attend conferences.
Secure a tenure-track position as an Assistant Professor and work towards tenure.

must_read_book.name: The Structure of Scientific Revolutions by Thomas S. Kuhn

Science & Research.name: Research Scientist (Industry)
Science & Research.description: Conducts research and experiments in a corporate setting to develop new products or technologies. They work in labs for pharmaceutical, tech, or manufacturing companies.
Science & Research.future_prospects: Leads to roles like Principal Scientist or R&D Manager. The work directly impacts commercial products, offering a different path than academia.
opportunities: Tech company R&D labs (e.g., Google Research, MSR)
roadmap: Bachelor's degree in a relevant science (e.g., Chemistry, Biology, Physics)
Obtain a Master's (MS) or Ph.D. for senior roles
Gain specialized lab experience
Apply for scientist roles in corporate R&D departments.

professional_body.name: The Scientific Research Honor Society (Sigma Xi)
